security: The document contains lists of individuals subject to travel restrictions, potentially impacting personal privacy and freedom of movement. Disclosing these names and the reasons for restriction could raise legal and ethical concerns.
summary: A memo from the FBI relays information from the Immigration and Naturalization Service (INS) regarding individuals subject to travel restrictions to Cuba, providing copies of INS documents to the Miami field office.
summary_one_paragraph: On July 29, 1965, the FBI distributed a memo relaying information received from the INS concerning individuals under orders not to depart the United States for Cuba. This communication included copies of an INS letter to steamship lines dated April 8, 1963, along with undated documents listing "Cuban Raiders Ordered Not To Depart" and "Notices of Prevention of Departure to Cuba," along with a document summarizing the total number of notices served. These materials, provided by Carl Burrows of INS headquarters to SA B. F. Rose, were furnished to the Miami field office.
title: Prevention of Departure to Cuba
